result.execSummary:
The defendant Elliot P Schuerr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime
PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

miscConds.notes:
Pay restitution in the amount of $4,645.00 and restitution surcharge Joint and Several with Trystan Oppert. Restitution is subject to defendant's right to challenge.
*NOTE: $500.00 was applied towards restitution leaving a remaining balance of $4145.00.
--------------------------------

Pay court costs.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
--------------------------------

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence.
--------------------------------

No alcohol.   No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.   No contact with victim without victim's and probation agent's consent. 
--------------------------------

IT IS ORDERED, pursuant to Wis. Stats. Sec. 973.015, that upon successful completion of the sentence imposed WITH NO VIOLATION OF THE RULES OF PROBATION, the Clerk of Court shall issue an order expunging the record.
--------------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.   Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.   The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.
--------------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.
--------------------------------
Pay Sheriff's Warrant fees in the amount of $78.32.

timeConds.notes: to commence on or before 07/09/2016 at 8:00 a.m. and with work release privileges.
Complete forty hours of community service work during EACH year of probation to a total of one-hundred twenty (120) hours of community service work WITHOUT buyout option.
